review: The Amazon Fire is easy to set up and it is a good streaming device. Note that it does not come with an HDMI cable, but that is not unusual for these things - just be aware that you will need to purchase that separately if you don't already have one. The voice search feature is very cool EXCEPT it only pulls programming from Amazon...pretty enormous glitch there, and kind of shady. Even if you have Netflix, for example, and are signed in - if you want to find a program - it will only pull Amazon programming. Just be aware so that you don't end up paying Amazon for something to which you have free access by virtue of a subscription elsewhere. The Roku (another streaming device) has a search feature (which is not voice activated) that will show you everywhere a program is available and give you price comparisons...that is what I was expecting from a search feature. I would have given this product five stars were it not for this shady little glitch with the voice search. Kind of disgusting and misleading for Amazon to advertise that you can search for programming easily with this feature when, in reality, you can search for programming ON AMAZON easily with this feature.
